unnormalised: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has announced that digital academic documents like mark sheets, passing certificates, and migration certificates will be available in DigiLocker, as usual. Students who appeared for the Class 10 and 12 exams can access these documents using their registration details. Makes sense, right?
normalised: The Central Board of Secondary Education (C-B-S-E) has announced that digital academic documents like mark sheets, passing certificates, and migration certificates will be available in DigiLocker, as usual. Students who appeared for the Class ten and twelve exams can access these documents using their registration details. Makes sense, right?

unnormalised: The official notice specifies that these documents are legally valid and accepted by higher education institutions and employers. So, if anyone asks for physical copies, just point them to DigiLocker. Seems like a good move for the environment and convenience.
normalised: The official notice specifies that these documents are legally valid and accepted by higher education institutions and employers. So, if anyone asks for physical copies, just point them to DigiLocker. Seems like a good move for the environment and convenience.

unnormalised: The board has also issued guidelines for students to access their documents. One needs to register on the DigiLocker app or website. For authentication, students require their registered mobile number, school code and roll number. A six-digit security PIN provided by their school is also a must.
normalised: The board has also issued guidelines for students to access their documents. One needs to register on the DigiLocker app or website. For authentication, students require their registered mobile number, school code and roll number. A six-digit security P-I-N provided by their school is also a must.
